mods.note: a , PERSIAN GULF RESIDENCY, BAHRAIN, 18th September, 1948, I paid a private visit to the Shaikh of Bahrain this morning and in the course of conversation mentioned that the Nawab of Bhopal would be passing through Bahrain . towards the end of the month (the subject arose through discussing His Majesty’s Government’s Treaty Relations with Moslem Rulers in India and it was this which led to my mentioning the matter). The Shaikh stated that he knew the late Begum very well and also her eldest son with whom he had been on shooting trips in India and with whom he had stayed for'a number of days, Neither the Shaikh or I know if the present ruler is the Begum’s eldest son ; The Shaikh said that he would arrange for an ’’istiqbal' but I do not think he proposes to meet the Nawab himself. I should be grateful if you would keep in touch with the Shaikh in the matter and doubtless you will meed; the Nawab yourself. 0 C. Pelly, Esquire, QBE., Political Agent, Bahrain. rsOT a s. 7'^0 S.O.No.C/R-194. POLITICAL AGENCY, BAHRAIN, Dated 4th October, 1948 Dear Colonel Galloway, £ f Please refer to your S.0.No.(120/2/48), dated the 18th September, 1948, about the Nawab of Bhopal’s passing through Bahrain. I did ask Parker to let me know when he was due, but he rung me up a few days’ ago* to say that he appeared to have slipped through his office’s hands. On the morning he rung up he said that a ’’Nawab Jung Bahadur and Begum” had passed through. I assume that this was Bhopal and I am sorry not to have met him and to have teen unatle to inform the Shaikh. Yours sincerely, His Excellency Lt. Col. A.C. Galloway, CIE, OBE, Political Resident, Persian Gulf, BAHRAIN.Telegram. From. To. No. 79 Dated the 8th October, 1948 En Clair. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file. File notes appear at the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 7; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between Cornelius James Pelly, Political Agent at Bahrain, and Lieutenant-Colonel Arnold Crawshaw Galloway, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf at Bahrain, concerning a stopover by the Nawab of Bhopal, Hajji Nawab Hafiz Sir Hamidullah Khan, in Bahrain in September 1948.
